name: Legion of Super Heroes: Magnetic Kid & Polar Boy Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: First introduced in 1965 ('Adventure Comics' #335) Magnetic Kid is the brother of which other member of the Legion of Super Heroes?
questions.explanation:
Cosmic Boy.

	Magnetic Kid (Pol Krinn) is the younger brother to Cosmic Boy.  Like all natives to the planet Braal, he has the ability to create and manipulate magnetism.

questions.text: Magnetic Kid idolized his older brother, and followed in his footsteps.  Prior to joining the Legion of Super Heroes, what career path had he selected?
questions.explanation:
Magno Ball competitor.

	Magnetic Kid became a pro magno ball player, reaching the status of a "champion" of the game, just as his older brother (Rokk/Cosmic Boy) had done years prior.

questions.text: After surviving a terrorist "fireballing" incident that claimed the life of his mother, Magnetic Kid decided to change his life's trajectory.  What decision did he make?
options: He created his own professional magno ball team
questions.explanation:
He joined the Legion Academy.

	Magnetic Kid excelled in his studies at the Legion Academy, before finally earning membership into the Legion proper in 'Legion of Super Heroes" (vol.3) #14, in 1985.

questions.text: After being admitted to the Legion, Magnetic Kid seemed to be oblivious to the constant romantic advances being made towards him by which older Legionnaire?
questions.explanation:
Lightning Lass.

	Having ended her relationship with Timber Wolf, Lightning Lass set her sights on one of the new younger members... Magnetic Kid.  He remained oblivious to many of her advances, and feigned ignorance of them when he did recognize them.

questions.text: Magnetic Kid's Legion career ended in 'Legion of Super Heroes' (vol.3) #62 (1989).  What caused his Legion career to be over?
questions.correct: He was killed in the line of duty
options: He resigned when his older brother returned to active membership
Mordru permanently stripped him of his powers
He got married and was forced to resign under Legion rules
questions.explanation:
He was killed in the line of duty.

	Pol sacrificed his life during the Magic Wars event.  He gave his life so that the Sorcerer's World could be re-opened and the Legion could fight on to victory.

questions.text: Polar Boy was first introduced in 'Adventure Comics' #306 (1963).  What did he do after being rejected for Legion membership?
questions.correct: He founded the Legion of Substitute Heroes
options: He temporarily became a super villain
He swore to come back the follow year to apply again
questions.explanation:
He founded the Legion of Substitute Heroes.

	He banded together four other rejected Legion applicants and created the Legion of Substitute Heroes.  This group assisted the Legion from time to time when needed, and also handled domestic problems when the Legion was off planet.

questions.text: What is Polar Boy's real name and home planet?
questions.explanation:
Brek Bannin from Tharr.

	Tharr is extremely dry and hot and almost uninhabitable.  Colonists built underground dwellings.  Those inhabitants with meta genes eventually gained the ability to generate cold and ice.

questions.text: Polar Boy later auditions again for the Legion.  What restriction does he request be lifted so that he can apply for membership?
options: The Legion's restriction of having full control of one's power
questions.explanation:
The Legion's age restriction.

	When Brek originally auditioned, he was one of the youngest candidates to ever apply.  However, he led the Substitute Heroes for many years, which placed him over the maximum age of 18 when he applied again.  He was admitted into the Legion in 'Legion of Super-Heroes' (vol.3) #14 (1985).

questions.text: In the Legion's "threeboot" continuity, Polar Boy is a member of the black ops group, The Wanderers.  In this continuity, what is Polar Boy's power set?
options: Telepathic communication with polar species and animals
questions.explanation:
Slowing molecular movement.

	Not only does he have a different power set, but his skin color is green.  After the Wanderers' leader (Mekt Ranzz) is jailed, Polar Boy and the remaining members fled to parts unknown.

questions.text: In the Legion "Retroboot/New 52" continuity, Polar Boy was held prisoner in a torture camp run by anti-alien forces.  He eventually loses a partial limb. Which was it?
questions.explanation:
Right Arm.

	His limb was torn off by the Legion villain known as Tusker.  Polar Boy is eventually able to create a replacement arm made out of ice, using his powers.
